meanings.definition: A metal pivot or journal at the end of a shaft or an axle, around which a wheel or other device turns.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic carefully greased the gudgeons to ensure smooth rotation.
meanings.sent2: The old cart's wheels creaked as the gudgeons turned on their axles.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the gudgeons of the spinning wheel.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a wheel with rusty gudgeons, struggling to find its pivot.
meanings.sent5: The gudgeons gleamed in the sunlight, a small but vital part of the machine.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily deceived or cheated; a dupe.
meanings.sent1: The scam artist targeted unsuspecting gudgeons looking for quick riches.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been a gudgeon in the elaborate con game.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tricked the gudgeons into believing his tales of treasure.
meanings.sent4: In the world of illusions, we are all gudgeons waiting to be fooled.
meanings.sent5: Beware of smooth talkers; they prey on innocent gudgeons with false promises.
